description: Brickwork/Additional structural strengthening to the north wall only of central hall to Cleaves Almshouses, (existing north gable wall has two small areas of bulges and split brickwork in the core of the wall).
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: As required by Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of any replacement bricks to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The method of repointing hereby approved as part of this permission shall be traditionally undertaken by hand methods only, using a lime mortar tinted to a matching colour to that as existing. Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic interest of this Listed Building is safeguarded.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy CS8 and development management policies DM10 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
